item.title: 10 Best Twitter Accounts Value Investing to Follow
item.description: Date: 2024-04-25 In the world of investing, value investing stands out as a strategy focused on finding stocks that appear underpriced relative to their intrinsic value. Social media, especially Twitter, has become a vital platform for sharing insights and strategies, making it easier than ever to access advice from leading experts. If you’re looking to deepen your understanding of value investing, here are the 10 best Twitter accounts to follow on X (formerly known as Twitter).

item.title: Michael Mauboussin, Bill Gurley - Putting Theory into Practice
item.description: Date: 2024-04-24 In a compelling dialogue, Patrick O’Shaughnessy engages with Bill Gurley and Michael Mauboussin, distinguished experts in their fields, on a variety of insightful subjects. Here’s a refined summary of their key discussions: AI’s Impact: The conversation begins with an exploration of artificial intelligence’s potential to either bolster industry leaders or pave the way for innovative newcomers. Investing in AI: Gurley stresses the necessity for a clear understanding of AI’s current capabilities and its implications for investment strategies.

item.title: Daily Digest #01: Modeling life, underatanding power and Gautam Baid talk
item.description: Date: 2024-04-22 1.Modeling Life: Oscillation Link Bullet points: • Oscillatory behavior refers to a cyclical system behavior that occurs in the human body. • The hypothalamus (H), pituitary gland (P), and gonads (G) are involved in a hormonal feedback loop. • There is a negative feedback loop where increased gonadal hormones inhibit hypothalamus hormones. • This HPG axis can be modeled using differential equations with sigmoid functions. • Oscillations arise from time delays in the feedback loop and steep negative feedback curves.
